skill.name: generate-image
skill.description: Generate or edit images using AI models (FLUX, Gemini). Use for general-purpose image generation including photos, illustrations, artwork, visual assets, concept art, and any image that isn't a technical diagram or schematic. For flowcharts, circuits, pathways, and technical diagrams, use the scientific-schematics skill instead.
skill.summary: Generate or edit images using AI models (FLUX, Gemini). Use for general-purpose image generation inc...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Legitimate image generation skill that makes API calls to OpenRouter for image creation and editing. No malicious behavior detected. Filesystem access is limited to user-specified input images and .env file lookup for API credentials.

content.user_title: Generate AI Images with FLUX and Gemini
content.value_statement: Create high-quality images for documents, presentations, and marketing materials using AI models. Supports both image generation from text prompts and image editing with natural language instructions.
actual_capabilities: Generate images from text prompts using OpenRouter AI models
Edit existing images with natural language instructions
Supports FLUX.2 Pro, FLUX.2 Flex, and Gemini 3 Pro models
Saves generated images as PNG files with customizable output paths
Automatically detects API key from .env files or environment variables
Handles base64-encoded image responses from API
limitations: Requires OpenRouter API key and credits for image generation
Processing time varies from 5 to 30 seconds depending on model
Image editing requires specifying input file path explicitly

use_cases.title: Create Scientific Illustrations
use_cases.description: Generate conceptual illustrations and visual assets for research papers and presentations

use_cases.title: Produce Marketing Visuals
use_cases.description: Create artwork, hero images, and visual content for websites and campaigns

use_cases.title: Design Presentation Graphics
use_cases.description: Generate backgrounds, diagrams, and visual elements for slides and posters

prompt_templates.title: Basic Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an image of [describe your subject] in [style] style

prompt_templates.title: Detailed Illustration
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a [style] illustration of [subject] with [specific details about colors, lighting, composition]

prompt_templates.title: Image Editing
prompt_templates.prompt: Edit the image to [specific change, e.g., change the sky to sunset colors, add an object, remove background]

prompt_templates.title: Scientific Visual
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a scientific illustration showing [biological or scientific concept] in [style] style, suitable for academic use

output_examples.input: Generate an image of a sunset over mountains with warm orange and purple colors
output: Ready for use in presentations or documents

best_practices: Be specific in your prompts describing colors, lighting, composition, and style
Use Gemini 3 Pro or FLUX.2 Pro models for both generation and editing capabilities
Check your OpenRouter credits balance before running batch image generation
anti_patterns: Using vague prompts like 'make it pretty' without specific direction
Passing API keys directly on the command line where they may appear in logs
Expecting technical diagrams from a general-purpose image generator

faq.question: What models are supported for image generation?
faq.answer: Google Gemini 3 Pro Image Preview, FLUX.2 Pro, and FLUX.2 Flex are supported. Gemini and FLUX Pro support editing.

faq.question: How long does image generation take?
faq.answer: Generation typically takes between 5 to 30 seconds depending on the model and complexity of the request.

faq.question: Can I edit existing images?
faq.answer: Yes, use the --input or -i flag to specify an input image path along with an editing prompt.

faq.question: Is my API key stored securely?
faq.answer: The script reads keys from .env files or environment variables. Avoid passing keys directly on the command line.

faq.question: Why is my generation failing?
faq.answer: Check that your OpenRouter API key is valid, you have sufficient credits, and your prompt is clear and descriptive.

faq.question: How is this different from scientific-schematics?
faq.answer: Generate-image creates photos, illustrations, and artwork. Scientific-schematics creates technical diagrams like flowcharts and circuits.
